title: Class 3 Math - Grouping and Classification
description: Test covering grouping objects, classification, and pattern recognition from Chapter 1
subject: Mathematics

questions.question: Which objects need electricity to work?
questions.explanation: TV and Fan need electricity to work, while Pillow, Blanket, Chair, and Bed don't need electricity.

questions.question: How can you group household objects differently?
questions.explanation: Objects can be grouped by color, size, material, or any other common characteristic.

questions.question: If you have 10 toys and group them into 'soft toys' and 'hard toys', which grouping method are you using?
questions.explanation: Grouping by soft and hard is grouping by material properties.

questions.question: Which of these animals would be in the same group as 'tiger'?
questions.explanation: Tiger and lion are both big cats and predators, so they would be in the same group.

questions.question: If you group animals by size, which animals would be in the 'small' group?
questions.explanation: Rat and dog are both smaller animals compared to elephant, tiger, and lion.

questions.question: How many different ways can you group the same objects?
questions.explanation: The same objects can be grouped in many different ways based on different characteristics.

questions.question: Which objects belong together because they are used for sleeping?
questions.explanation: Pillow and Blanket are both used for sleeping and comfort.

questions.question: If you group objects by 'things you can sit on', which objects would be in this group?
questions.explanation: Chair and Bed are both objects you can sit on.

questions.question: Which grouping method would put 'apple' and 'banana' together?
questions.explanation: Apple and banana are both fruits, so they would be grouped together by type.

questions.question: If you have 12 pencils and group them by color, how many groups might you have?
questions.explanation: The number of groups depends on how many different colors of pencils you have.
